title: Artichokes Preserved in Oil
source: The Food of Sicily - Fabrizia Lanza
servings: Makes enough to fill four 8-ounce (240 ml) jars
categories: The Food of Sicily - Fabrizia Lanza
ingredients: 2cups (500 ml) neutral-flavored oil, such as grapeseed
directions: 1. Squeeze the juice from the lemons into a large bowl of cool water and drop in the squeezed halves.2. Break off and discard all the tough outer leaves of each artichoke. Halve each one lengthwise and remove the choke. Cut into wedges and place in the lemon water.3. To sterilize the jars, boil them and their lids for at least 10 minutes, then drain and set aside.4. In a large pot, bring vinegar and water to a boil. Add peppercorns, bay leaves, garlic, and salt.5. Drain the artichokes and discard the lemon halves. Add the artichokes to the boiling brine and cook for 2 to 3 minutes, until slightly softened but still crunchy.6. Transfer artichokes to a towel-lined sheet pan using a slotted spoon and pat dry.7. Place 3 to 4 whole cloves into each sterilized jar. Pack in the artichokes, pressing lightly.8. Mix the grapeseed and olive oils in a spouted measuring cup and pour into the jars to cover the artichokes, leaving Â½ inch (1 cm) of headspace.9. Run a clean knife along the sides of each jar to release air bubbles. Ensure artichokes are fully submerged in oil.10. Seal with lids. Let sit for 1 to 2 weeks before consuming.
